paragraphs.title: Twitter and API + Streaming for Data Science
Lets Go Get a Front Page...  Our President Elect
paragraphs.text:
%python
import sys
import os
sys.path.insert(0,"/notebook/pythonpckg/Chap02_03")
#print(sys.path)
#print(os.environ)

from twitter_client import get_twitter_client
import json
client = get_twitter_client()
profile = client.get_user(screen_name="realDonaldTrump")
# print(json.dumps(profile._json, indent =4))

os.system('cd /notebook && python /notebook/pythonpckg/Chap02_03/twitter_get_user_timeline.py realDonaldTrump')
os.system('head -n1 /notebook/user_timeline_realDonaldTrump.jsonl')

paragraphs.title: Lets Check out Donald's Vocabulary (without stop words like "the")
paragraphs.text:
%python
import os
os.system('python -m nltk.downloader stopwords') ###get the stopwords dependency remover
os.system('cd /notebook && python /notebook/pythonpckg/Chap02_03/twitter_term_frequency.py user_timeline_realDonaldTrump.jsonl')

paragraphs.title: Find Tweet Clusters of Similar Topics in Stream
paragraphs.text:
%md
![](http://lin1pr1ap6:8765/random_images/tfidf.jpg)

- #### The workhorse is the TfidfVectorizer (http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.feature_extraction.text.TfidfVectorizer.html)

![](http://lin1pr1ap6:8765/random_images/kmall.png) 

- #### Simple K-Means to form groupings of like feature vectors http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.cluster.KMeans.html

msg.data:
